result.title: SEP e-Platform
result.description: The e-Platform (English and Spanish versions) will include the necessary sites, contents and tools developed during the project. The e-platform will include the creation and development of three segments regarding three different ways of access: - Basic information, for non-registered users: only the main public information of the project will be available. - General access (for registered users): accessible for all registered users. - Intranet (only for partners): this site will be only accessible for the partners of the project and it will include the main deliverables related with the managing of the project and the e-platform. The e-platform will include a number of different sites and resources for general access (Interactive guide, Useful documents and resources, SEP financial assessment Tool, SEP Data Bases, Forums, Webinars, Frequent Asked Questions (FAQ)).

result.title: Technoeconomic analysis of the selected biofuels combustion
result.description: Using the inputs obtained from tasks 5.2 and 5.3 as well as the results of the market studies performed within task 2.1, BIOS will perform techno-economic evaluations regarding the utilisation of the selected biofuels in the tested stoves/boilers. The performance parameters and an evaluation of the economy of the whole system (e.g. investment and operation costs) will be compared with techno-economic performance data of state-of-the-art residential wood pellet as well as natural gas fired boilers. The main results of these studies will comprise conclusions regarding the suitability of the combustion equipment to comply with the efficiency and emission limits established in the existing relevant standards and legislation, the identification of technological improvements as well as conclusions regarding the economic competiveness of these appliances when utilising BIOMASUD fuels.

result.title: Update of BIORAISE GIS platform's information
result.description: As relevant stakeholders within the biomass sector will be considered the agroindustries (oil and nut companies), biomass and biofuel producers and suppliers, boiler and stove manufacturers, installers and ESCos. If the industrial production is not available, estimations will be made according accepted industrial conversion rates. Stakeholders data will be provided from the national market studies of the task 2.1 The integration of the information will be carried out following the methodology of BIORAISE, applying the market and environmental restrictions established in BIORAISE in order to estimate the available biomass from the potential resources and costs, as well as calculating the transport costs. All the participants will collaborate with CIEMAT in supplying, as mentioned, the national relevant data as well as giving suggestions of restriction factors to the use of biomass potentials in their respective countries that will be discussed with CIEMAT. TFS will perform software adaptations in order to introduce the new country datasets in the BIORAISE platform
